info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 9:36AM CDT until September 23 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Huntsville AL
info.description:
FFWHUN
The National Weather Service in Huntsville has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Limestone County in north central Alabama... Northwestern Madison County in north central Alabama... Southern Lincoln County in middle Tennessee...
* Until 1245 PM CDT.
* At 936 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across Limestone and Madison counties in Alabama and southern Lincoln County in Tennessee. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain has fallen, with 2 to 3 inches that fell in some areas within 30 to 45 minutes. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible as showers and storms train over these locations over the next couple of hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntsville, Madison, Athens, Fayetteville, Meridianville, Moores Mill, Redstone Arsenal, Hazel Green, Ardmore, Harvest, Alabama A And M University, University Of Alabama In Huntsville, New Market, Tanner, Lincoln, Elkmont, Toney, Elkwood, Taft and Capshaw.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Limestone, AL; Madison, AL; Lincoln, TN
